Prognosis of primary IgA nephropathy

* Very variable. As a rule, the disease progresses very slowly''' '''''
* 20-30% of patients develop end-stage renal disease within 20 years of diagnosis.
* Poor prognostic factors are :
** clinical ''':''''
*** presence of renal failure at diagnosis,
*** severity of hypertension,
*** significance of proteinuria,
*** male sex;
** histological ''':''''
*** severity of proliferation,
*** glomerular sclerosis and interstitial fibrosis,

question.title: What is a poor prognostic factor for primary IgA nephropathy?

option_a.title: Presence of renal failure at diagnosis
option_a.description: This option is a poor prognostic factor for primary IgA nephropathy

option_b.title: Severity of hypertension
option_b.description: Hypertension is a risk factor for IgA nephropathy, but it is not a poor prognostic factor

option_c.title: Significance of proteinuria
option_c.description: Proteinuria is a marker of kidney damage, but it is not a poor prognostic factor

option_d.title: Male sex
option_d.description: Sex is not a known prognostic factor for IgA nephropathy

correct_option.title: Presence of renal failure at diagnosis
